result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aisha R Turner

defendant.name: Turner, Aisha R
defendant.address: 5277 West Fairy Chasm Road, Brown Deer, WI 53223

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aisha R Turner in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Aisha R Turner.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for motion hearing on Defense Oral Motion of Admissibility of Evidence/Video without further authentication. State did not file any objections by the deadline.  Arguments placed on the record. 

Based on statements put forth by Court and parties, Court GRANTS Defense motion to use video without further authentication. Use of the video during trial to be determined on the trial date.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 1, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for March 8, 2023 at 09:00 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Aisha R Turner in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Aisha R Turner.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. Defense informs the court they no longer want a DPA hearing, and requests a trial date. Discussion held. Defense would like a motion hearing date prior to a trial. Deadline to file documents is September 14th, 2022.
Case adjourned.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Aisha R Turner in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aisha R Turner appeared by phone means with Attorney. Case in court for DPA hearing. Defense requests adjournment for reasons set forth in the record. State does not object.   DPA Hearing adjourned to Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Aisha R Turner in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense advises the Court this case is in resolution posture and anticipates the case resolving with a DPA. Court orders matter adjourned for DPA hearing. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
forwarded to Commissioner Roth for review
Oral No Contact Order with EC.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Aisha R Turner in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
